image.altText: Trump sits at a conference table beside two men in black suits

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has appeared to reopen the door on seeking regime change in Iran, taking to his social media platform to question if it would "make Iran great again". Follow live.

title.children: Trump flags regime change push in Iran as Tehran vows response to US 'aggression'

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Blue Room

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says action to prevent Iran from getting a nuclear weapon was acceptable, but that talks should now resume.

title.children: Australia backs US strikes on Iran while urging return to diplomacy

image.altText: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

props.synopsis: Iran is promising a mighty punishment for US strikes on its nuclear sites. But it has few options for actual retaliation, and none of them are good.

title.children: A humiliated, desperate Iran has few options to retaliate against the US

image.altText: B-2 Spirit bomber

props.synopsis: How the US employed distraction and misdirection to fly an 18-hour stealth-mode mission and drop 14 "bunker-busting" bombs on Iran's nuclear facilities in Operation Midnight Hammer.

title.children: As the B-2 bombers headed west as a decoy, a secret package headed east to Iran

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks at podium inside the White House

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump insists his party is united behind his decision to bomb Iran's nuclear sites, but some vocal Republicans are speaking out against it.

title.children: 'Tired of the wars': Trump's MAGA critics denounce Iran strikes

image.altText: Xi Jinping in a navy suit and red tie clapping his hands and smiling slightly

props.synopsis: America is sidetracked and weakened by wars and unrest. Donald Trump understands the problem but has been unable to resist the pressure from America’s military establishment and Israel.

title.children: While America makes war, China is peacefully remaking itself

image.altText: GettyImages-2220804928

props.synopsis: As Minjee Lee won her historic third major, a mention of her golfing brother highlighted the tyranny of distance between the two Australian stars.

title.children: The family message that stood out as Minjee Lee created golf history

image.altText: A young woman with dyed red hair.

props.synopsis: Police allegedly found a shortened firearm and ammunition while searching a car and a Gin Gin home.

title.children: Tanika Bromley remains in custody amid weapons charges case

image.altText: Jim Chalmers blue room

props.synopsis: Labor’s timidity may finally be evaporating but the backlash over tax reform is coming and it could get ugly.

title.children: 'Boomers beware' threat won't cut it as government opens door to tax reforms

image.altText: Police and fire and rescue stand around a smashed up car on a tow truck.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are searching for two teenagers they believe were involved in a collision that killed a woman and an unborn baby.

title.children: Horror weekend on NSW roads as national toll hits 15-year high

image.altText: A trader looks up at a chart on his computer screen while working on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

props.synopsis: The ASX 200 opens lower, as one of the first markets to trade in the wake of the US bombing raid on Iran. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Global markets on edge after Iran attack as oil rises

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX clawing back earlier losses, down 0.6% as oil price eases
Oil shocks, inflation and interest rates
Would OPEC 'save the day' if oil supplies disrupted?

image.altText: A man with short hair and a tshirt poses solemnly for a photo, with a pair of black sunglasses on the top of his head.

props.synopsis: In 2023, Clint Seares's partner Kerrie Carroll died by suicide the day after being discharged after a previous attempt. He is worried the system still has not changed.

title.children: Kerrie left hospital clutching medication. She died 36 hours later

image.altText: A baby girl in a pink jumpsuit

props.synopsis: The mother of a seven-month-old girl with a congenital heart condition who died at Royal Darwin Hospital after waiting nine hours to see a doctor is suing the hospital for negligence.

title.children: Mother whose baby died after nine-hour wait for help sues Darwin hospital

image.altText: Mid shot of Rachael Gunn wearing Olympic uniform, blurred out crowd behind, pulling face and throwing hands forward.

props.synopsis: There's an elite club of Olympic losers who we love to celebrate. A year on from Raygun's infamous performance, Australian Story investigates why she isn't one of them.

title.children: Australia loves an underdog, so why did it all go so wrong for Raygun?

image.altText: A man stands with a phone in his hand by a silo

props.synopsis: A mobile outage has affected Dalby in Queensland's Western Downs, leaving many businesses and locals unable to access the internet, EFTPOS or make calls, with the Telco warning customers could be impacted for up to two weeks.

title.children: Telstra tower upgrades leave locals unable to make a call for a week

image.altText: Tyrese Haliburton, Shai Gilgeous Alexander, Lu Dort

props.synopsis: A heartbreaking injury ends Tyrese Haliburton's magical playoff run as Lu Dort's 'moonball' and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's MVP mastery decides Game 7 of an epic NBA Finals. Here are your quick hits from a thrilling series finale.

title.children: Quick hits: Injury heartbreak, 'moonball' and an MVP's masterclass decide epic NBA finale

image.altText: A banner hanging on a bridge in Venice that says no space for Bezos

props.synopsis: The billionaire is set to hold an opulent three-day wedding in Venice this week. And some locals are not happy about it.

title.children: The eye-watering details of Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's Venice wedding

image.altText: Pink and blue glowing cloud against a backdrop of orange stars.

props.synopsis: A stunning nebula and a sky dotted full of stars and galaxies are in a set of three images released by the Vera. C. Rubin Observatory as a taster of more to come.

title.children: First images from Vera C. Rubin Observatory released a taste of what's to come

image.altText: Alleged assault on a Brisbane bus

props.synopsis: He is accused of punching a 46-year-old man multiple times on a city council bus at South Bank station on Friday night.

title.children: Man charged with assault after alleged attack of Brisbane bus driver

image.altText: AC/DC's Angus Young performs live, wearing blue schoolboy outfit and playing black guitar, at London's Wembley Stadium

props.synopsis: The Australian rock icons return home to play five stadium-sized shows in November and December.

title.children: AC/DC announce first Australian shows in a decade

image.altText: A man with shaved head and moustache, wearing black tshirt, folds arms and looks to side smiling with mouth closed.

props.synopsis: Holden Sheppard was feeling frustrated by restrictions of young adult fiction, and by being told he couldn't write about certain things. This time he's written a novel for adults, and he's pleased that nothing has got in his way.

title.children: WA author pens 'gay bogan love story' that's also about male loneliness

image.altText: A corridor inside a jail with locked doors.

props.synopsis: Two 'sovereign citizens' are sentenced to a month in jail in Western Australia, with a judge warning their "extremely dangerous" ideas would not be tolerated.

title.children: 'Sovereign citizens' receive prison sentence after defying court order

image.altText: Survivor Richard Tempest sitting with volunteers at the Childers Cultural Centre in June 2000

props.synopsis: Richard Tempest was expecting to start his first day of work on a zucchini farm when he was jolted out of his sleep 25 years ago by loud smashing sounds. That's when the former UK backpacker noticed the flames and "intense heat" coming from downstairs.

title.children: Australia's deadliest hostel fire still 'very vivid' 25 years on

image.altText: The seven members of BTS wearing yellow suits and holding three American Music awards

props.synopsis: Suga's discharge from the South Korean military on the weekend means all members of the K-pop group BTS have now completed the country's mandatory national service.

title.children: Last remaining member of BTS discharged from military

image.altText: GettyImages-2221581037

props.synopsis: Oklahoma City Thunder claim their first NBA championship since their relocation from Seattle in 2008.

title.children: Thunder claim NBA title after Pacers star goes down with brutal injury

image.altText: The building, pictured from the ground

props.synopsis: The remote Ngaanyatjarra Council's decision to base itself 1,800 kilometres away in Perth has traditional owners questioning their input into major decisions.

title.children: Land council's Perth CBD base raises concerns in outback community

image.altText: GettyImages-2221552635

props.synopsis: Australian Minjee Lee wins the third golf major of her career, claiming the Women's PGA Championship by three shots in Texas

title.children: 'Sacrificed so much': Minjee's heartfelt tribute to family after major victory

image.altText: An older lady in a wheelchair, in a pink top and green puffer, sits in front of a lemon tree.

props.synopsis: Allied health services like physiotherapy can be life-changing for NDIS participants, but new government pricing arrangements mean services that need to travel to clients may be too expensive.

title.children: NDIS pricing changes 'incredibly cruel' says remote mobile therapy provider

image.altText: David Janetzki wearing a suit and glasses looks into the camera

props.synopsis: Treasurer David Janetzki is due to deliver the LNP state government's first budget on Tuesday.

title.children: Queensland 'facing challenges' in first LNP budget, treasurer says

image.altText: A damaged church

props.synopsis: Syria's interior ministry has blamed Islamic State for the attack, which targeted a packed Sunday service at a church in Damascus.

title.children: Suicide bombing on Syrian church kills at least 22, injures dozens

image.altText: An artist render of a concrete building surrounded by grassland.

props.synopsis: A waste incinerator designed to burn 400,000 tonnes of rubbish a year is proposed for Lara, an area in the outskirts of Geelong. Locals vehemently oppose the project on environmental grounds and because of a lack of information about who will build it.

title.children: The Chinese state connections behind Lara's waste incinerator

image.altText: A man and a woman in their seventies since on a bench in their garden amongst flowers.

props.synopsis: Mick Tomkins is one of many Victorian power station workers suffering from asbestos-related cancers and the only remaining support group is calling for more funding to stay active.

title.children: Calls for help as power workers continue to die from asbestos exposure

image.altText: Two women stand on a beach holding giant inflatable breasts.

props.synopsis: When Carol Smith was diagnosed with breast cancer, she relied on the kindness of strangers on the internet. Now, she's part of a growing West Australian movement committed to making sure women don't struggle alone.

title.children: Meet the women on a 'slightly unhinged' cancer support mission
